_header: Feed the hunger the thirst give drink
Subjects: mercy, works of; carols, of religious counsel
_description: John Audelay, The Seven Works of Mercy — five 5-line stanzas (ababc) including ‘I cownsel þe’ refrain plus burden (cc): ‘Wele is him and wele schal be / That doth the vii werkis of merce’

BodDou302.First Lines:
ffede þe hungere þe þirste ȝif drenkecloþ
                    þe nakid as y ȝoue say…
BodDou302.Last Lines:
…þus wil þai playn ham to heuen kyngI cownsel
                    þe

Chambers,  Edmund Kerchever,  and  Frank Sidgwick.

         5 (1910): 473-91: 480-1.

                        ed.  
             John Audelay: The Poems.
EETS
         o.s. 184 (1931); repr. 1988: 183.
Greene,  Richard Leighton. 
             The Early English Carols.
         Oxford: Clarendon, 1935; 2nd ed., rev., Oxford: Clarendon,
            1977: 224; 1977, 198.
